column4: Need to fix update manager. I keep getting a message that is damaged, and I need to run "sudo dpkg install -f" but I've run ut several times already but it does not fix the problem.. Is there some directory I can delete to restart it?
What is the best way to transfer my ubuntu to another hard drive? Is there some imaging utility?
I can't use it in linux right? I bought a bigger hard drive for my laptop and it's in an external USB enclosure right now,, I want to dupe my whole OS to the new drive.. How do I do that?
the big drive is an USB drive you mean?
yeah.. it a 120 drive and the one in my laptop was only a 60gb..
so I wanna dupe my drive then switch it with the 120 in the usb case.
Any ideas how to do it?
let me check if theres a good image program for linux :)
mm.. sure, if i find that program it could be easy , variant what u suggest ?
partimage is what you need i think
